intro: Centaurea ornata f. tenuisecta, commonly known as the slenderleaf gladiola, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and striking, bright yellow to orange inflorescences. This subspecies is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
